eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Undergraduate Quantum Computing
eventData.description:
The Yale undergraduate Quantum Computing (YuQC) group is a network of peers working to better understand and leverage principles of Quantum Computation. Yale has notably driven innovation at the frontiers of quantum information science for the past few decades. Our student organization was thus formed out of a necessity to bridge the gap between Yale’s vibrant graduate research community in quantum engineering and the potential quantum scientists in its undergraduate student body.

YuQC is fundamentally an organization that brings together students in the pursuit of knowledge and interdisciplinary innovation. To accomplish the breadth of our goals, we are thus committed to fostering an inclusive environment that best supports the diversity of our talented membership.

Come join our Yale undergraduate Quantum Computing Group Social. Learn more at yaleqc.com and qchack.io.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Climbing Team
eventData.description:
The Yale Climbing Team climbs weekly at a local New Haven climbing gym. Additionally, we host social events and occasionally members of the team climb outdoors!

Come join the Yale Climbing Team for a "knotty" evening! Grab a shoelace or piece of rope and learn 4 knots (1 for climbing and 3 for everyday use) to conquer the challenges of campus life!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Women and Gender Minorities in Comp Sci
eventData.description:
We are a group dedicated to creating a supportive community on campus for women and gender minorities interested in computer science. We include everyone from life long coders to non-majors looking to learn coding! Each year, we host a variety of events including social events to build our community, professional events to help prepare our members for future opportunities like jobs and internships, and events to aid our members with their academics.

Come learn about Yale Women and Gender Minorities in Computer Science! Ask questions about WGiCS, being a women in CS, or CS at Yale in general and play some games/brain teasers.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Mixed Martial Arts Club
eventData.description:
We are the Yale Mixed Martial Arts Club. Formed by combining the former Muay Thai Kickboxing Club and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Club, we focus on all aspects of the fighting arts; stand-up striking, ground fighting, submissions, etc. We welcome people of all experience levels and fighting backgrounds (if any), and want to create a community where people can share and learn about martial arts from each other. All equipment provided, sparring is optional. Only requirement is that you come prepared to work out a sweat!

Q&A session about the club, martial arts in general, or just about life. We'd love to get to know you all not just as fighters, but as members of the club family!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Party of the Left
eventData.description:
Yale’s oldest leftist debating society focused on the most pressing political and philosophical questions facing the contemporary left.

“Sorry to Bother You” Watch Party
The Party of the Left will be meeting to watch and discuss the film, Sorry to Bother You (2018) and its implications for race, class and labor politics.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Undergrad Esports Club
eventData.description:
Yale Esports is dedicated to developing and promoting an environment at Yale University for individuals and teams to explore their interests in the internationally growing esports community in an inclusive, supportive, and respectful environment.

Get to know YUEC during one of our monthly Discord Game Nights! Stop by to meet club members over casual games like Stardew Valley, Among Us, Rainbow Six Siege, and League of Legends. We welcome a variety of skill levels and are always open to trying new games!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: FIRST at Yale
eventData.description: We are the official FIRST Robotics alumni group of Yale University. Open to both alumni and those interested in robotics, we mentor robotics teams, volunteer at competitions, and help the next generation of students in STEM. Come hang out with FIRST at Yale!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Machine Learning Society
eventData.description:
The Yale Machine Learning Society (YML) is an undergraduate students group committed to providing an open forum for students of all backgrounds to learn and discuss advances in machine learning, as well as bringing the broader Yale community with the latest technological breakthroughs in AI research. Our planned activities include study groups exploring ML basics, weekly paper reading groups, and talks given by ML experts.

Join YML, Yale's undergraduate society for machine learning, as we walk through tutorials on how to use machine learning for image recognition and text analysis. On Friday, April 9th, we'll walk through the basics of building and training a model for image recognition, and on Friday, April 23rd, we'll walk through how to build a chatbot using natural language processing and deep learning!

eventType.name: Showcases
eventType.description: From talent shows to student group performances, showcases are an opportunity to see the warmth and energy of the Yale community.

eventData.headline: Yale Student Showcase
eventData.description: Check this page on April 10th for a release of the Yale Student Showcase video library! Get ready to dance, sing, and jam alongside some of our student groups as they showcase their many passions and talents. Who knows? Maybe you'll be a part of some of these very same groups in the years to come ;D
eventData.locationText: Check back on April 10th for the videos!

eventType.name: Cultural Centers
eventType.description: These events are created in coordination with the cultural centers and student groups that operate within them.

eventData.headline: Meet DOWN MAG
eventData.description:
Members of the DOWN will introduce themselves, talk about the different sections in the magazine, and 4 or 5 of the members will read some of their works to the audience. Then we will breakout in breakout rooms and make our own pieces together on Mad Libs. After 10-15 minutes, we will share our pieces in the main zoom room.

https://yale.zoom.us/j/2171252588
